entry.title: Roseburg Water Main Project On SE Pine Street To Resume Feb. 23
entry.summary: Work resumes Feb. 23 on a Roseburg water main upgrade along SE Pine Street between Oak and Sykes. Crews will replace aging pipe, install hydrants and update service lines. One lane will be closed during weekday work hours, with construction expected to continue into early summer.

entry.title: Cheese & Thank You Campaign Returns to Douglas County, Serving Up Comfort Food for a Cause
entry.summary: UCAN’s Cheese & Thank You campaign returns this March, with local restaurants across Douglas County donating $2 from featured cheesy menu items to the UCAN Food Bank. A kickoff event with free grilled cheese is set for Feb. 28 in Roseburg to launch the month-long fundraiser.

entry.title: FISH AND WILDLIFE COMMISSION DENIES CRAB PETITION
entry.summary: February 23, 2026 6:50 a.m. On Friday the Oregon Fish and Wildlife Commission voted 6-1 to deny a petition that requested crab fishery rules be modified to further reduce the risk of whale entanglement, while urging the department to continue its planned rulemaking process and engagement with NOAA fisheries to obtain endangered species act coverage....

entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop

entry.title: HEAVY RAIN POSSIBLE FOR REGION STARTING MONDAY AFTERNOON
entry.summary: February 23, 2026 3:50 a.m. Heavy rain is possible for much of the region from Monday afternoon through Tuesday. A Hydrologic Outlook from the National Weather Service in Medford said a warm sourced atmospheric river, commonly referred to as a Pineapple Express, will likely bring periods of moderate to heavy rain. Forecasters said widespread amounts...

entry.title: COMMISSIONERS ISSUE PROCLAMATION FOR SCOUTING AMERICA
entry.summary: February 23, 2026 3:40 a.m. Last Wednesday, Douglas County Commissioners Tom Kress, Chris Boice and Tim Freeman issued a proclamation at their weekly business meeting calling upon all citizens of the county to observe February 2026 as Scouting America Month. A county release said Scouting America, formerly known as the Boy Scouts of America, was...

entry.title: CITY COUNCIL TO CONSIDER AGREEMENT FOR SIGNAL IMPROVEMENT PROJECT
entry.summary: February 23, 2026 3:30 a.m. The Roseburg City Council will consider authorizing the city manager to execute an agreement with the Oregon Department of Transportation for a signal improvement project as part of its meeting on Monday night. In October of 2023 the council authorized the city manager to enter into an IGA with ODOT...

entry.title: PINE STREET WATER MAIN REPLACEMENT PROJECT CONTINUES
entry.summary: February 23, 2026 3:20 a.m. A water main replacement project is resuming this week along Southeast Pine Street between Southeast Oak Avenue and Southeast Sykes Avenue in Roseburg. A city release said a project that began in September has resumed to replace about 3,200 linear feet of 6-inch-diameter water main with new 8-inch-diameter pipe. The...

entry.title: PARKING METERS BEING REMOVED, NEW PARKING SIGNS GOING IN
entry.summary: February 23, 2026 3:05 a.m. City of Roseburg Public Works crews began work last week to remove all parking meters and install new parking signs downtown. A city release said the project began on February 18th on Southeast Kane Street and is moving west across downtown to Southeast Sheridan Street. Street crews are taking out...

entry.title: FINAL SEATS REMAINING FOR 12TH ANNUAL TASTE OF ITALY BENEFIT DINNER
entry.summary: February 23, 2026 2:50 a.m. Benefit Dinner. The event will be on Saturday, March 14th at the Douglas County Fairgrounds. Doors open at 4:30 p.m. The evening includes a social mixer, buffet dinner, and a dessert dash. There will also be live and silent auctions, inspiring stories and the return of the popular Golden Cork...

entry.title: Autism Awareness Walk Planned in Roseburg Following Fremont Middle School Investigation
entry.summary: An autism awareness walk is planned March 1 at Fir Grove Park in Roseburg following the Fremont Middle School injury investigation. Organizers say the event aims to raise awareness and invite community participation after a grand jury declined to indict two aides.

entry.title: Roseburg man transforms life through drug court and helps others recover
entry.summary: Jack Salberg, after overcoming a 29-year addiction with the help of Douglas County’s H.O.P.E. Drug Court and RSAT program, is now supporting others in recovery by raising funds for Oxford Housing residents.

entry.title: ADDITIONAL STATE PARKS WILL REQUIRE DAY USE PARKING PERMITS
entry.summary: February 23, 2026 12:30 p.m. Starting March 30th, the Oregon Parks and Recreation Department will no longer waive the parking fee at 22 additional day-use parks. The day-use parking permit is currently $10 for in-state visitors and $12 for out-of-state visitors and is valid for the entire day of purchase at any Oregon state park....

entry.title: WIND ADVISORY THROUGH 7:00 A.M. SUNDAY
entry.summary: February 21. 2026 5:00 p.m. A Wind Advisory is in effect through 7:00 a.m. Sunday for portions of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said southeast winds of 20 to 30 miles per hour with gusts of 45 to 50 miles per hour are expected. The Advisory area includes the higher...

entry.title: Umpqua Valley Public Defender To Launch Equal Justice Initiative With Community Art Show In Roseburg
entry.summary: The Umpqua Valley Public Defender will debut its Equal Justice Initiative at a Roseburg art show featuring Jerome Sloan. The $5 entry event includes a silent auction and community dialogue. Proceeds will support rural public defense recruitment and training efforts across Oregon.

entry.title: UTILITY AGREES TO PAY $575 MILLION TO SETTLE CLAIMS FOR WILDFIRE DAMAGE
entry.summary: February 21, 2026 9:10 a.m. PacifiCorp has reached a comprehensive settlement, agreeing to pay $575 million to resolve all known federal claims for damages related to the six 2020 wildfires. In Oregon this includes the 242 Fire near Chiloquin, the Archie Creek Fire east of Glide the Echo Mountain Complex Fire near Otis, and the...

entry.title: ONE DRIVER TAKEN TO HOSPITAL AFTER FREEWAY CRASH
entry.summary: February 21, 2026 8:30 a.m. One driver was taken to the hospital after a freeway crash late Thursday afternoon. An Oregon State Police report said just before 5:30 p.m. troopers responded to the wreck on Interstate Five northbound near the Highway 99/Highway 42 Winston exit. A van had rear-ended a sedan causing damage to both...

entry.title: Roseburg mom pulls kids from Fremont Middle School after son suffers broken arm in class
entry.summary: A Douglas County grand jury issued a "no true bill" for instructors Brian Marsters and Erich Hoque, finding insufficient evidence to pursue criminal charges related to injuries sustained by students at Fremont Middle School, including a 13-year-old nonverbal autistic boy;…

entry.title: PacifiCorp Agrees to $575 Million Settlement With U.S. Over Six Western Wildfires Including Archie Creek
entry.summary: PacifiCorp agreed to pay $575 million to settle federal claims tied to six wildfires in Oregon and California. The funds will reimburse suppression costs and support land restoration. The settlement resolves allegations only, and the company continues to deny liability.

entry.title: Grand Jury Declines Charges Against Two Fremont Middle School Instructional Aides
entry.summary: A Douglas County grand jury returned a no true bill for two Fremont Middle School instructional aides, finding insufficient evidence to pursue criminal charges in a case involving injuries to two students. An investigation into a separate teacher at the school remains ongoing.

entry.title: Roseburg Begins Downtown Parking Meter Removal, New Time-Limit Signs Going Up
entry.summary: Roseburg crews are removing downtown parking meters and installing new signs for free, time-limited parking. The changes expand one-, two-, and three-hour zones and include updated permit fees for city lots and the parking garage. On-street permits will be available once signs are in place.

entry.summary: Live from Salem, State Senator David Brock Smith has an update on legislation being debated in Salem.

entry.title: Ask A Master Gardener: Supporting bees when nothing blooms
entry.summary: Question: A couple weeks ago I saw a bumblebee out and about. Don’t they usually hibernate? Are there things I can plant in my yard to support them when nothing much is blooming?

entry.title: LOCAL REAL ESTATE TODAY 02.20.26
entry.summary: Mary Gilbert of the Mary Gilbert Group at Keller Williams Southern Oregon has our weekly local look at real estate.

entry.title: Police Log: February 19, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police reported arrests for warrants, DUII and trespass, a stolen-vehicle crash with injuries, theft and camping citations, and a multi-vehicle injury crash Feb. 19, according to the department’s daily activity logs.

entry.title: FREEZING FOG ADVISORY THROUGH 9:00 A.M. FRIDAY
entry.summary: February 20, 2026 8:00 a.m. A Freezing Fog Advisory is in effect until 9:00 a.m. Friday morning for much of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said visibility as low as one quarter mile in freezing fog is forecast. The Advisory area includes the Umpqua Basin, Illinois Valley, lower Rogue Valley...

entry.title: Thrilling reads for exciting times
entry.summary: Between watching the Winter Olympics and the medical drama “The Pitt,” my adrenaline has been pumping this month. For readers seeking a thrill, I recommend these recently published books.

entry.title: Cow Creek Umpqua, Forest Service sign new stewardship agreement
entry.summary: Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians and U.S. Department of Agriculture Forest Service signed a new shared stewardship agreement, designed to expand collaborative forest and rangeland restoration in the Umpqua and Rogue River-Siskiyou national forests.

entry.title: Notice of intent issued for revisions to BLM's O&C Resource Management Plan
entry.summary: Since 1937, over 2 million acres of Oregon's timberland has remained under the jurisdiction of the U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI) as O&C timberlands. Now, plans dictating how those lands are managed may be going through major changes.

entry.title: Roseburg Schools To Host Final Early Literacy Night For Young Families March 9
entry.summary: Roseburg Schools will host its final early literacy night March 9 at Rose Elementary for families with children ages 2–4. The free event includes storytelling, hands-on activities and take-home materials for early readers. Registration is required and space is limited.

entry.title: Respected and beloved: the life of Terry Lea Deane
entry.summary: Terry Lea Deane, or “Grandma Terry” to her family, doted on her great-grandkids, was a jokester with a contagious laugh, and didn’t go anywhere without her lapdog Sadie.

entry.title: DCSO requests help to locate missing Canyonville resident
entry.summary: Douglas County Sheriff's Office announced around 3 p.m. Thursday that it located Hannah Olsen in the Azalea area, alive and unharmed, and has notified her family. No further updates are expected.
